document_data.name: Daryn Falburn
document_data.mainbody:
Flame '''Daryn Falburn''' ({{Pronounce|De|ryn|FALL|burn|refs={{Cite adventurers league/Stopped at the Gate|11}}}}) was an officer in the [[Flaming Fist]] that served the city of [[Baldur's Gate]] during the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].{{Cite adventurers league/Stopped at the Gate|3-5}}

{{Quote|Welcome to Baldur's Gate. Is it everything you've hoped for?|Flame Falburn, to people seeking refuge in Baldur's Gate.}}
document_data.Description: She was quote tall with striking red hair and vibrant green eyes.
document_data.Personality: Daryn was a direct, and no-nonsense individual. She was wholly dedicated to her duties within the Flaming Fist, and cared little for making friends. While sympathetic to the plights of the less fortunate, she remained cynical that they could receive meaningful aid.
document_data.Activities: Her offices were located in the second story of the [[Basilisk Gate]], which separated the [[Lower City]] district of [[Baldur's Gate/Eastway|Eastway]] from the [[Outer City]] neighborhood of [[Stonyeyes]].
document_data.History:
When scores of refugees fled [[Elturel]] in the {{YearlinkName|1492}}, Flame Falburn made numerous attempts to help them find refuge in Baldur's Gate. She was one of the few officers of the Fist still dedicated to keeping order within the city. At the same time, she was working with a group of [[adventurer]]s to investigate a series of gruesome murders.

After two initial killings, Falburn enlisted the adventurers to uncover the truth about yet another killing in [[Baldur's Gate/Bloomridge|Bloomridge]] neighborhood of the [[Lower City]]. She directed them to work with Manip [[Tradran Foremantle]], and warned them that Manip [[Benn Hithlin]] could be an agent of the emerging [[cult of Zariel]].{{Cite adventurers league/Hungry Shadows|3}} Together they uncovered the whereabouts of an actual devil named [[Gharizol]] had been summoned within Baldur's Gate.{{Cite adventurers league/Hungry Shadows|9-10}}
